author: Zach Seemayer ET Online
title: Tom Bergeron pays an emotional tribute to his late father on "DWTS"
text:
Tom Bergeron made an emotional return to "Dancing with the Stars:" on Monday after missing last week's episode to be by his ailing father's side.
13 Photos "Dancing with the Stars" season 21 An look at the celebrity contenders and their professional partners for the new season of "DWTS"
At the start of the show, Tom made sure to thank Season 19 champion Alfonso Ribeiro, who filled in for him as "DWTS" host so that he could see his father in his final days.
Tom's dad, Raymond Bergeron, died from an illness this week and the 60-year-old "DWTS" host made sure to honor his late father during at the end of Monday's episode.
"I want to take a moment to say that my dad loved this show," Tom said during the show's closing credits. "Never missed an episode. And I'd like to think somewhere that he didn't miss this one."
Watch: Tom Bergeron to miss "Dancing with the Stars" to be at sick father's bedside After the episode, Tom took to Instagram where he shared a sweet photo of himself and his father. Tom memorialized his dad in the caption, writing, "At my wedding and in my life, The Best Man. RIP."
A photo posted by Tom Bergeron (@tombergeron) on Oct 12, 2015 at 8:21pm PDT
Tom also shared a heartfelt memory of his father on Twitter, writing, "My Dad, looking back on his life, had one word for all of his worries; 'insubstantial.' Nicely said."
